relation: Clears the BIOS password. You must reboot the server for the clear password operation to take effect. You are prompted to create a new password when the server reboots.
pageTitle: CLI Configuration Guide for Cisco UCS E-Series Servers and the Cisco UCS E-Series Network Compute Engine Integrated Management Controller, Release 2.x - Managing the Server [Cisco UCS E-Series Servers] - Cisco
textBeforeTable: Procedure You must log in with user or admin privileges to perform this task. Before You Begin Do not change the boot order while the host is performing BIOS power-on self test (POST). Note Configuring the Server Boot Order Configuring BIOS Settings Managing Server Power Unlocking Cisco IOS CLI Configuration Changes Locking Cisco IOS CLI Configuration Changes Shutting Down the Server Resetting the Server Configuring the Server Boot Order This chapter includes the following sections: Managing the Server Server BIOS Settings Restoring BIOS Defaults Clearing the BIOS Password Clearing the BIOS CMOS Configuring Server Management BIOS Settings Configuring Advanced BIOS Settings Viewing BIOS Status Configuring BIOS Settings Unlocking the Server's Front Panel Power Button Locking the Server's Front Panel Power Button Power-Cycling the Server Powering Off the Server
textAfterTable: Note    The options are not case sensitive. You can select one or more of the following: cdrom—Bootable CD-ROM Virtual-CD fdd—Floppy disk drive Virtual-Floppy hdd—Hard disk drive RAID Cypress Virtual-HiFd pxe—PXE boot GigEth0 GigEth1 GigEth2 GigEth3 efi—Extensible Firmware Interface   Step 3 Server /bios # commit   Commits the transaction to the system configuration.   Step 4 (Optional) Server /bios # show detail   Displays the server boot order.   The new boot order will be used on the next BIOS boot.
